channel.title: Unpacker works but my repacker gets error
channel.description:
.. well i get this
[code] Exporting New Cache Files.
Runescape Cache Exporter 3.0 -/- (C) 2006 Troy Osborne -/- -------------------------------- Parsing Rules... java.io.FileNotFoundException: .\runescape\silabdat_0.dat2 (The system cannot fi nd the path specified) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at cacheexport2.Main.ProcessRules(Main.java:121) at cacheexport2.Main.main(Main.java:37) Read Error: ./runescape/silabdat_0.idx Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException at cacheexport2.CacheFile.<init>(CacheFile.java:38) at cacheexport2.Main.ProcessRules(Main.java:127) at cacheexport2.Main.main(Main.java:37)
Press any key to continue . . .
[/code]
Well.. this guy told me that i needed to change somthing in a .dat file.. in the data folder i got.. meh

item.title: Unpacker works but my repacker gets error
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

First of all, that will not unpack anything but the runescape/ subfolder in most cache folders.
So it will not work trying to unpack silab’s dat files.

Another thing to point out is, that unpacker is not a repacker. Be sure to also read your debug errors when it says

(The system cannot find the path specified)
That means, well, that the system cant find the path given. Therefore, the path you gave does not exist.

And the guy who “hinted” you to edit your dat file wasn’t knowing what he was saying. Editing the settings dat file for the unpacker just changes the path to your cache folder for the unpacking process.

Read full topic
item.source: Unpacker works but my repacker gets error
